issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: The RM performs a loopback connection to itself to renew its own tokens.  If app submissions consume all RPC handlers for {{ClientRMProtocol}}, then app submissions block because it cannot loopback to itself to do the renewal.
fields.summary: RM app submission jams under load

comments.body: The RM needs to short-circuit the RPC loopback connection to itself, and directly/internally renew its own tokens.  I attempted to do this in the JT for 1.x, so I'll dig up the patch.
Daryn - do you remember the JT jira?

Proposed patch that works on 23.  The RM token renewer will short out to a secret manager if configured with one and the token address is local.  Successfully tested on a secure cluster.

Trunk/branch-2 have moved files around caused dependency issues that I need to resolve.
Renaming patch with correct jira id!

Things got shuffled on main and caused dependency woes.

Removed private renew/cancel from YarnClientImpl that essentially was commented as it shouldn't be there.  Moved renewer into identifier class like other tokens.  Added much better tests.  Otherwise it's pretty much the same as the original patch.

{color:green}+1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12567149/YARN-355.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:green}+1 tests included{color}.  The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:green}+1 findbugs{color}.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:green}+1 core tests{color}.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-client hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-common hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-resourcemanager.

    {color:green}+1 contrib tests{color}.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-YARN-Build/375//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-YARN-Build/375//console

This message is automatically generated.

{{NetUtils.isLocalAddress}} doesn't check ports, which would break an unlikely scenario - multiple RMs on the same host, with one RM renewing the other RM's tokens.
Other than that, the patch looks good.
Cancelling till Sid's comments are addressed. Daryn, if you could fix it asap I'd appreciate it - it's one of the 2 hadoop-2.0.3 blockers... :) Thanks!

I did somewhat intentionally neglect checking the port since I was trying to post a minimal patch, and I thought it would be extremely unlikely and not make sense for two RMs to run on the same host.  I'll update it to check the port.
Check token service addr against RM addr and correctly handles RM addr being a wildcard or not.  Also add more comprehensive tests.

This message is automatically generated.

Needs one fix, which I don't spot in the last review.

clientRM.getBindAddress() will end up getting null - since the value is only set after ClientRMService.init is called. Ideally, it needs to be called after the ClientRMService starts.

Other than this, looks good.
Thanks Sid.  Updated patches to set TSM service after client has started.
